docs.snippet: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on what you’re obliged to reveal when applying for long-term-care insurance and whether to call out a relative’s bigoted Facebook posts.

headline.print_headline: Must I Share My Medical Fears With an Insurer?
headline.main: Must Suspicions About Personal Health Be Shared With an Insurer?

docs.snippet: A report suggests that one in five smartphone users worldwide deploys software to remove ads when he or she browses the web.

headline.print_headline: Rise of Ad-Blocking Software Could Cost Web Companies Billions in Lost Revenue
headline.main: Rise of Ad-Blocking Software Threatens Online Revenue

docs.abstract: One in five smartphone users, amounting to almost 420 million people worldwide, use ad-blocking software when browsing web on their phones; shift threatens Internet companies like Google and Facebook that rely heavily on advertising.

docs.snippet: Dive under the sea and listen to the language of dolphins and whales in virtual reality.

headline.main: Farhad’s and Mike’s Week in Tech: Snapchat Old Hat? Oh, and Theranos

docs.snippet: The social network, rebutting allegations that it suppressed conservative articles, is meeting with Republican pundits and politicians to explain its process.
What happens when precious repositories of intimacy are scattered or sold — and then found by a stranger?

headline.print_headline: The Digital Afterlife of Lost Family Photos
headline.main: The Digital Afterlife of Lost Family Photos

docs.abstract: Teju Cole On Photography column examines significance and value of family photographs once they become separated from family they once belonged to.

docs.snippet: The promise of big data and big paychecks is drawing some of academia’s top economists to study consumer behavior for tech companies like Airbnb, Amazon and Uber.

headline.print_headline: Goodbye, Ivory Tower. Hello, Candy Store.
headline.main: Goodbye, Ivory Tower. Hello, Silicon Valley Candy Store.

docs.snippet: Changes in technology like ad blocking, and the dominance of platforms like Facebook leave many publishers unsure of how they will make money.

headline.print_headline: Faltering Ad Revenue and Traffic Bring Uncertainty to Online News
headline.main: Media Websites Battle Faltering Ad Revenue and Traffic

docs.abstract: Announcements of budget cuts and layoffs at number of news media companies have brought industry to edge of panic as web traffic plateaus and online advertising becomes less reliable; many publishers are unsure how to make money in digital environment dominated by social media, particularly Facebook, and mobile applications.

docs.snippet: On Tuesday Mark Zuckerberg is expected to address Facebook Messenger and Facebook Live among other topics.
The Instagram mobile app offers an easy way to automatically post the same photo and caption information on your other social networks.

headline.print_headline: Post One Photo in Many Places

docs.abstract: Tech Tips Q&A; suggestions on how to post Instagram photos on Facebook and Twitter simultaneously.
